    Teaching Assistantships

    Privacy Policy, Law and Technology

    Graduate Course, Carnegie Mellon University, 2025

    As a Teaching Assistant for Privacy Policy, Law, and Technology, I guided students through complex discussions on data privacy, ethical considerations, and legal frameworks in technology. I supported learning by answering questions, clarifying concepts, and facilitating engagement during seminars and office hours. I also helped review assignments and track student progress to ensure the course ran smoothly.

    Humanoid Robotics and Cognition

    Graduate Course, Carnegie Mellon University, 2025

    As a Teaching Assistant for Humanoid Robotics and Cognition, I helped students navigate hands-on robotics experiments and understand how sensors, control systems, and AI come together. I offered guidance during labs and office hours, answering questions and supporting students as they explored complex concepts. I also reviewed lab reports and tracked student progress to help the course run smoothly.

    Applied Stochastic Processes

    Graduate course, Carnegie Mellon University, 2024

    As a Teaching Assistant for Applied Stochastic Processes, I supported the course by preparing instructional materials and clarifying complex concepts for students. I provided individualized assistance during office hours and recitations, fostering student engagement and understanding of stochastic modeling techniques. I also graded assignments and maintained accurate records of student progress to ensure effective course management.
